to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
Propaganda Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China
pinyin: Zhong1 gong4 Zhong1 yang1 Xuan1 chuan2 bu4

definition: Propaganda Department of the Communist Party of China
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Gong4 chan3 dang3 Zhong1 yang1 Wei3 yuan2 hui4 Xuan1 chuan2 bu4
containing_words.word: 中国共产党中央委员会宣传部

definition: Central Propaganda Department (abbr. for 中國共產黨中央委員會宣傳部|中国共产党中央委员会宣传部[Zhong1 guo2 Gong4 chan3 dang3 Zhong1 yang1 Wei3 yuan2 hui4 Xuan1 chuan2 bu4])
the crime of instigating counterrevolutionary propaganda
pinyin: fan3 ge2 ming4 xuan1 chuan2 shan1 dong4 zui4

sentences.english: Therefore, statuary had turn into a three-dimensional political picture poster.
sentences.chinese: 由此，雕塑成为了一种立体的政治“宣传画”。

sentences.english: Instead, he fell victim to his faith in the anti-fat propaganda.
sentences.chinese: 很可惜，他成了“反对脂肪”宣传的牺牲品。

sentences.english: Encourage them to integrate forests into their publicity or philanthropic work.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励他们将森林问题纳入其宣传或慈善工作。

sentences.english: The North views Southern pamphleteering as hostile propaganda.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜认为韩国的传单为恶意宣传。

sentences.english: As such this contribution is rather a blatant example of ego-tripping and questionable self-promotion on the part of the author.
sentences.chinese: 所以，这看起来更像是作者的自吹自擂和自我宣传。

sentences.english: Most colleges do not pay energy to promote cheerleading publicly.
sentences.chinese: 大多数高校甚至没有对啦啦操做任何宣传。

sentences.english: I imagine that Party propaganda people will not pursue this line, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我不相信党的宣传人员会采信这一点。

sentences.english: Receive alarm hind, prefectural public security bureau and department of propaganda of county Party committee undertook checking instantly.
sentences.chinese: 接警后，县公安局与县委宣传部立即进行了核查。

sentences.english: For social youth groups, public propagand is necessary.
sentences.chinese: 对于社会的青少团体，更要加强宣传力度。

sentences.english: Gates said that the effectiveness of aid is not well-publicised.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨说援助的有效性没有被充分宣传。

sentences.english: The government will phase out an advertising campaign.
sentences.chinese: 政府将分阶段开展广告宣传。

sentences.english: The cost of media is an important but troublesome consideration.
sentences.chinese: 宣传媒体的开支是件非常重要而又很麻烦的事。

sentences.english: Their advocacy about celebrity sometimes let youngsters become fans of so-called idols.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宣传有时会让年轻人陷入偶像崇拜之中。

sentences.english: Curing parents by cutting thigh is the common topic to promote filial piety in the dramas of the Ming and Qing Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 割股疗亲是明清戏曲宣传孝道的常用题材。

sentences.english: They built up the product by advertising.
We have a ban on the propaganda of homosexuality and paedophilia.
sentences.chinese: 我们禁止对于同性恋和恋童癖的宣传。

definition: to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
amusing speech or act/jokes/antics/funny/amusing/Taiwan pr. [xue1 tou2]
to be a spokesperson/to be an ambassador (for a brand)/to endorse
military banner/flag signal/(fig.) banner (i.e. false pretenses)
